page.title: 07Recreation in Featherstone
page.content: The most popular form of recreation in this area is watching the local Rugby League team Featherstone Rovers.A highlight in their history came in 1983 when Featherstone beat Hull at Wembley.In the 1983-84 season things did not go so well with first round exits in the Yorkshire Cup and the RL Cup but the club did shine towards the end of the season with a spectacular win in the John Player Cup.Another memorable occasion for those at Post Office Road was when the long-awaited floodlights were switched on during a game against Wakefield.In the 1984-85 season they were knocked out in the preliminary rounds of the RL Cup and in the early rounds of the John Player Cup but they did reach the semi-final of the Yorkshire Cup.A final blow for the club came when during the night of the 6th February the stand burned down
